trans-unit.source: Represents the default HTTP cache policy for network resources.
This class cannot be inherited.

This class corresponds to the [\<defaultHttpCachePolicy\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/defaulthttpcachepolicy-element-network-settings.md) configuration element.
This class is used to specify the HTTP caching configuration that applies to network resources obtained by using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebClient> classes.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement"></xref> class.

This constructor adds the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MaximumAge%2A>, <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MaximumStale%2A>, <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.MinimumFresh%2A>, and <xref:System.Net.Configuration.HttpCachePolicyElement.PolicyLevel%2A> properties to the collection.
Gets or sets the maximum age permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
If the cached copy of the resource is older than the specified time value, the resource must be revalidated by comparing the cached resource to the resource on the server.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value that specifies the maximum age for cached resources specified in the configuration file.
Gets or sets the maximum staleness value permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
This property specifies the amount of time after content expiration during which the cached copy of the resource is acceptable.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value that is set to the maximum staleness value specified in the configuration file.
Gets or sets the minimum freshness permitted for a resource returned from the cache.
This value specifies the amount of time before content expiration, during which the cached copy of the resource is acceptable.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> value that specifies the minimum freshness specified in the configuration file.
Gets or sets HTTP caching behavior for the local machine.
Applications typically use <xref:System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel.Default> as their cache policy level.
The <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property, if not `null`, determines the cache policy in effect for a request.
A <xref href="System.Net.Cache.HttpRequestCacheLevel"></xref> value that specifies the cache behavior.
